Articles.Content:
I'm building a "cat-walk" platform on a large heavy lander in 100% stock, can't decide on what to use for side-rails.

I've tried I-Beams but they're a tad too big,

I've tried struts but my Kerbals tend to clip right through them,

for the moment, I'm using a whole bunch of 1x1 panels but that increases the part count too much.

why can't we have actual guard rails in stock?

Cubic octagonal struts maybe?

For future reference:
- Gameplay questions belong in the gameplay questions forum. Please post there from now on if you have a question you want answered.
- Struts do not have colliders - the visible bar is only a visual effect and has no physical influence whatsoever.
TweakScale can rescale pretty much anything.

I'd like to have something like this too!

Rule of thumb for stock parts, if you can attach something to it, a kerbal will not clip through it.

1 hour ago, Xyphos said:

I'm building a "cat-walk" platform on a large heavy lander in 100% stock, can't decide on what to use for side-rails.

I've tried I-Beams but they're a tad too big,

I've tried struts but my Kerbals tend to clip right through them,

for the moment, I'm using a whole bunch of 1x1 panels but that increases the part count too much.

why can't we have actual guard rails in stock?

 

I'm having difficulty thinking of anything less Kerbal than guard rails.

 

-Jn-

53 minutes ago, JoeNapalm said:

 

I'm having difficulty thinking of anything less Kerbal than guard rails.

 

-Jn-

Yeah. What's next? Safety goggles?

Try ladders. I've never used them for guardrails myself but if the lander tips, you can have your kerbals hang onto them hollywood-style.

Edited April 28, 2016 by Snikersnee
"Don't let go!" "I'm three feet above the ground."

Maybe the small landing gear leg in its extended position attached to some small cubic struts. I don't think Kerbals clip through them.
edit - derp, meant landing leg, not gear, that would look weird!
 

Edited April 28, 2016 by katateochi
nope, ladders dont do, antenna neither

There's a mod for ... oh.

Why can't we have everything stock including everything there's a mod for!?
